Subjective: Irritated Left eye since Tuesday morning on waking. Sensation of foreign body (dust/hair). Initially rubbed it, which worsened redness. Left eye feels 'thicker' than Right. Right eye also became red starting yesterday. Pain only on squeezing eyes shut hard. Eyes 'a bit stuck' in the morning. Vision normal. Negatives: No specific trauma, no new cosmetics (mascara/cream), no contact lenses, no photophobia, no general illness/flu. Social: Has a young daughter (Isa); boyfriend is away on holiday. ICE: Researched online, suspects eye infection; wants confirmation and to know if drops/antibiotics are needed; concerned about contagiousness.
Objective: Eyes: Bilateral conjunctival injection (redness), Left > Right. No foreign body visible on eversion of upper or lower eyelids. Eyelashes normal. Pupils equal, round, and reactive to light.
Plan: 1. Explanation: Viral inflammation of eye surface, self-resolving. 2. Timeline: Usually resolves within 2 weeks. 3. Advice: Do not rub eyes. Clean stuck eyelids in AM with lukewarm tap water. 4. Meds: Artificial tears as needed for soothing (OTC). Rinsing not recommended. 5. Safety Net: Return if not improved in 2 weeks, or sooner for increased pain, significant pus discharge, worsening eyelid matting, or any vision changes. 6. Follow-up: PRN in 2 weeks if symptoms persist.
